interestingFact: Home to the world’s first 'ice hotel,' rebuilt every year from ice and snow.
Contains the Amazon rainforest, the largest tropical rainforest in the world.
Has more vending machines per capita than anywhere else—over 5 million total.
Has three capital cities: Pretoria (executive), Cape Town (legislative), and Bloemfontein (judicial).
Nearly all its energy comes from renewable sources like geothermal and hydro.
Hosts the Kumbh Mela, the largest human gathering on Earth, every 12 years.
First country to grant women the right to vote in 1893.
The least densely populated country in the world, with about 2 people per sq km.
Measures success by Gross National Happiness instead of GDP.
Most linguistically diverse country, with over 850 languages spoken.
